creator: petr.pisl@sun.com
text:
If I have this page:
<%@page contentType="text/html"%>
<%--<%@page pageEncoding="ISO-8859-2"%>--%>
<html>
    <head><title>JSP Page</title></head>
    <body>
    </body>
</html>

Then the second page directive is parsed as well and the response encoding and
the file encoding is ISO-8859-2. It should be ISO-8859-1.

creator: mschovanek@netbeans.org
text:
The original case is fixed but if I compile this page:
<%-- --%>
<%--<%@page pageEncoding="xxx"%>--%>
<html>
    <head><title>JSP Page</title></head>
    <body>
    </body>
</html>

Jasper throws:
JasperException: Unsupported encoding: xxx

Without the 1st comment the page works fine.

JSP.1.6 Quoting and Escape Conventions

Quoting in Scripting Elements
A literal %> is quoted by %\>
creator: allistair.crossley@qas.com
petr.pisl@sun.com
text:
I don't understand how your comment influence this issue. This issue is that jsp
parser returns encoding from jsp comment.
